Reviews.Title: Only docking a star for camera quality - easy to setup/use/monitor
Reviews.Author: Candace Strickler
Reviews.Content: I have been using this system now for over 6 months. It has never crashed, and has actually saved me in a legal matter. A major delivery company delivered 3 laptops to my home, leaving them on my porch - except they really only delivered 2! Caught on tape! BAM, no problem getting that claim paid extremely quickly.The set up of the dvr is not entirely intuitive. It does include a helpful CD/DVD installation media; which includes a full manual, and software for most every platform for controlling and viewing the cameras. The best resource is the company's website. They have a very robust website, with video links to every imaginable question answered and demonstrated on film.You could just stick up the cameras, plug them in, and everything would work. No doubt, most will want to delve in a bit to customize some of the settings.I will break this into 2 sections. The DVR itself including software, and the cameras.The DVR:It is black in color, light weight, and housed in a metal case. The are multiple ports on the back for up to 16 bnc connectors, Video out: vga (dsub) and BNC (includes adapter BNC to RCA plug), usb mouse, ethernet, pan tilt and zoom, and DC power supply input.You should know that if you are putting this near your entertainment stack, there is an annoying red light that will incessantly blink when motion is detected and the unit is recording. You can obviously fix this with a bit of tape.The interface is a bit quirky, but you can figure it out fairly quickly. Mostly, left click selects, and right click takes you back. Somehow the network autoconfigure, automatically opened all of the necessary ports on my Verizon FIOS router. I am capable of accomplishing this task, but it was nice not to have to worry about it. The main port that need to be opened is 9000 (media) and port 80 (web) on your network. You will also need your IP address. (this is the ip for your router, not your computer) visit ipchicken . com to find it quickly.!!!!!<<<<< note >>>>> !!!!!I do not recall seeing it anywhere in the manual - but you MUST set a user name AND password for any of the network stuff to work.You will need to adjust the color for your cameras. None of my cameras had good color by default. I was able to achieve pretty good results by fooling around with the color options in the  camera control submenu.Other than setting the motion areas (accomplished by clicking and dragging) - and color - recording time slots, if you choose that -- there is not much else use for the dvr's menus. Most everything else you will do through the web interface.I did not use the DNS web address that is offered. I used the nightowl dvr software (NETVIEWER) that is available from the website or off of the cd. It is very robust, and allows for a multitude of options. From the nightowl dvr software menu you can designate cameras to send you digital snaps when motion is detected (you need a gmail address). To use NETVIEWER you need to have port 9000 open on your router. Then input your ip address (ip chicken - remember) the user name (you pick) and password (no restrictions here).From netviewer you can play back captured footage. Simply select a date, and a channel (camera), you will then be presented with a time-stamped list of all the recordings for that date. As you play back these files, they are automatically saved to your computer. The default path is under "Local Settings". Once these files have been downloaded, you can really easily convert them to standard *.avi file using the converter that is on the included dvd (or download from website). it takes mere seconds and I used it to give to the police, and the delivery company.There are Pan/Tilt/Zoom features available in the Netviewer console as well, however - none of the included cameras have this feature.You can also playback LIVE video only, using an iPad or iPhone. The Nightowl app is available in the app store. It is a drag that you can only view live video, but their support team has assured me that you will have that ability in an upcoming release.One GREAT use for this is checking to see if your amazon delivery has been left on your porch yet or not!Overall the DVR does exactly what it claims. I have a 500gb drive, and I still don't think I have begun to overwrite yet (another feature you can set from the DVR interface). The playback is clear, and reliable. The motion capture record works very well. You can have it capture june bugs flying around, up to squirrels, or only catch the delivery driver stealing your laptops.THE CAMERAS:They are a step up from total crap. They do not fogup, so far none have failed, and if they do get a little rain on them, it tends to roll off quickly. I did treat mine with rain-x so they work even better now, but it was never a problem before through rain, sleet, AND snow.You get 8 with the STA186. They are all the same. A hooded full metal body, and painted metal base. The cameras are connected to the dvr via the included BNC+DC combo cables that are included. I think they are all 60ft long. I needed 2 cables of 100ft, which I found here on amazon for a very reasonable price. The power is provided by 2 included DC power supplies (some people call them transformers). Each power supply powers 4 cameras (there is a sort of Hydra connector that turns the single plug into 4). Be sure to note the 'sex' of your cables before you run them. It matters which way the power plug goes! I was in some pretty inhospitable spots with my install and would never want to have to go back. I used a 5/8" speed bore for my cable runs to get through. This is a fairly tight squeeze that requires you to first push through the BNC connector, then power connector. A little expanding foam or caulk will fix the hole.The camera mount is secured by 3 screws. The included screws are total crap - you will likely want to use your own. You will want to the have the cameras removed from the base while mounting the bases. The camera is easily removed from the base by unscrewing the set screw that allows the camera to rotate around a recessed collar. The further adjustment of the camera is accomplished by a ball-socket connection that can be secured using the finger adjustment nuts.A helpful hint I used was to have the iPad on the ladder with me as I adjusted the cameras.One issue with the cameras is the night-vision feature sometimes creates some distortion in medium-low light. When the camera is getting confused as to whether to run in night mode or full color. Speaking of Night mode - they shine here. The night vision feature is excellent, and in some ways more clear than the full color.My overall impression is very good on the system as a whole. The biggest complaint is the camera quality. The DVR interface is a little less than intuitive - but the NetViewer software is excellent. iOS APP works great on the iPhone and the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Super happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: C Graham
Reviews.Content: I have owned  camera systems in the past, and recently purchased this Night Owl system and am pleasantly surprised by the level of customer support I have received from them. I was able to reach their 24/7 tech support via phone after I got home from work.  2 things of note, 1st, its awesome that they are open any time as I hate calling from work as this unit is for home, and 2nd, the support wasn't overseas with someone reading from a training manual (Cassandra was very nice and professional).The cameras are solid and are simple to install, others I’ve used in the past are cheap plastic.  They include a simple 1 page quick start guide that will get you from start to finish, and also watched the how-to videos on the Night Owl website [...] which were very helpful.Ended up calling support and she configured my network settings and got me hooked up on the internet in less than 10 minutes and now I can view all my cameras using my iPhone. The app they told me to download was “Night Owl Lite”…best part about it is it’s FREE.This is a lot of system and service for such a great price.  Will probably be buying another one in the near future for work.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value and Unbelievable Customer Service.
Reviews.Author: Steve Leach
Reviews.Content: Bought on a lightning deal for under $200.00.  I had already bought two other systems and returned them both because they were complicated and not very "user friendly".I decided to keep this one because it advertises LIFETIME customer support.  Finally I made a good decision.  This system works great.  I have zero networking experience but the excellent customer service people not only explained what to do but logged on to my PC and set everything up for me in a matter of minutes.They even made a hand typed note explaining how to do some basics and placed it on my desktop so I could not lose it.  Seriously, who does that?  This is customer service at its finest.I made a mistake and pointed one of my cameras towards the front yard where it picked up every car driving down the highway which resulted in hundreds of emails a day.  I called customer service again and was up and running perfect in under 5 minutes.The cameras and DVR function exactly as described.  I only have DSL basic and was concerned the quality might not be very good.  This was not a problem.  Video is not choppy and the clarity if fine.I am waiting for this to go back on a lightning deal so I can buy a second one for my primary residence.I highly recommend this product.I hope you found my review helpful.

Reviews.Title: Decent System for Price Minor Security Problem
Reviews.Author: theguardianii
Reviews.Content: I bought this system mainly because of its price and the decent reviews across the web of the company. It is not a high end system but it will do for regular home surveillance.  I tested the product out of the box and everything I tested worked fine.  The cameras came on and the DVR was functional.  (did not test the system over the internet)  The IR is not the best outdoors but you get better IR inside the home due to the reflection of the IR light off the surfaces in the home.  The Cameras will do well for facial recognition within 10-20 feet this would be the typical range in which you'd expect to find that in this price range.I gave this system 3 stars due to its ability to be tampered with and the fact the images of the cameras lead you astray.  I live in a ranch style home meaning I'm in a single story and I cannot place my cameras up high enough that they could not be tampered with easily.  The wires attached to the Camera for both power and video feed are exposed to the elements which leaves them highly susceptible to vandalism.  Other systems have a "vandal-proof"  design where it goes through the post and is covered.The camera system should be enough of a deterrent but some criminals consider it a challenge and will look for blind spots or vulnerabilities.  I'd rather not welcome the challenge and make it easy.Other than the mentioned security risk this system is a sound investment especially for internal building surveillance as well higher than one story mounting outdoors.  I'd recommend this purchase for people in those two situations that are looking for a cheap system for security surveillance.

Reviews.Title: Great starter unit - side effect includes Camera Acquisition Syndrome!
Reviews.Author: Hollis Kelvin Lee "The Pseudo Chef"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this DVR back in December 2012 after months of research. I know its not the best product and perhaps not even the best in its class but it does the job well (with a little help as I'll explain later).After I missed out on all the thanksgiving sales when the newer model was $249, I was extremely pleased when I found this model as a warehouse deal. The item arrived in excellent condition.Getting the system connected was quite simple as the quick setup posters provides the exact steps required to get the unit up and running.The O/S of the dvr manages the 500Gb rather efficiently as I can get 35-40 days of video on all channels with motion activated recording.The port forwarding feature is a bit challenging for me but once you have a static external IP you should have no issues. So for now I have the system connected to my local network and so I can view from any smart device tablet laptop desktop etc. This means that I can monitor from any room in the house with dedicated viewing on three devices all wireless. No more wondering who is at the front door or what was that sound outside. Until I have the port forwarding configured I am using the email feature to provide 'near real time' snapshots of alarms while I am away from the house.The video quality is best on CIF for me as the higher resolution produce choppy videos. The view angle is also quite restricted at 42 degrees making camera placement critical. Although I have the entire property covered there were a couple blind spots. To address this I purchased a couple 600 TVL cameras with 90 degree viewing angles and I can say on those channels video and picture quality have improved tremendously and at that angle there is perfect overlap of the viewing ranges i.e. no blind spots.So if you just want a simple unit to get started in home security this is a great place to start. But note it is inevitable you would develop Camera Acquisition Syndrome as coined by an earlier reviewer.

Reviews.Title: Sensitivity
Reviews.Author: David P. Manasas
Reviews.Content: Almost USELESS. Imagine you come home each day and review the security camera video captured during the day. You are looking for anything that triggered movement. Regretably, it takes forever with this unit. EVEN ON MINIMUM sensitivity, the cameras record almost continuously and you can only go forward 16x speed. So, reviewing the days activity takes....all evening. Yes, you can 'mask' areas to keep the motion sensed to a minimum, but those are the areas YOU WANT to trigger the cameras! I find that when I do this, someone would have to jump up and down in front of a camera to make it sense motion! I have another brand unit and it is far superior, only recording when someone enters the cameras range. Without masking. So it takes 5-10 minutes to see what happened. Also it seems like this product was designed and developed in a non-English country. The instructions and on-screen menus are not easy to follow. Password, enter, then MENU BUTTON to go to the next item?  It took a long time just to figure that one out!

Reviews.Title: Recorded
Reviews.Author: Joanna Hale
Reviews.Content: It can and does record for longer that 4 days and I believe it will record for up to 30.  It has a limited range, because its small but will capture a room or a portion of the yard.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but there are some caveats...
Reviews.Author: JWR
Reviews.Content: Overall, this security camera setup seems to be a solid platform, but it falls short in several key areas.First the good parts - the cameras seem to be well built, the IR night vision works quite well, although certain colors can be distorted (during my testing, in normal room incandescent lighting, my navy blue shirt appeared light gray on the camera).  This isn't really a deal-breaker, but it's important to note in case you ever find yourself trying to describe what an intruder is wearing to the cops. The cameras and DVR are relatively easy to connect to each other using the illustrated setup guide.You'll need a few things in order to be able to use this system to it's full potential.  First, you'll need high-speed internet (DSL at the very least), and access to your router or modem's settings/admin. Its necessary to set up port forwarding. I had to call my ISP to get my router's login info. This system connects to the internet via ethernet cable. Because my router is in a different room than the DVR, I spent an extra $50 for a Netgear N300 wi-fi to ethernet adapter, instead of running 100ft. of cat5 cable under carpet and through walls. It works great for this purpose, and I'd recommend it. You'll also need to know your ISP's email settings. Another thing they don't mention - if it's necessary for you to update the DVR's firmware, the only way to do it is by using a USB flash drive.  Not a big deal, but its one more expense if you don't already own a flash drive (I couldn't find any of mine and had to buy another).Now for the bad parts. The software in this system really falls short. Even though the company has numerous videos on their website, it seems as though the videos only cover the things that are clearly covered in the included manuals. I had to call their tech support twice to get the system working to the point that it is now.  I am able to view my camera feeds through my smartphone (which is why I initially purchased), but I still haven't been able to figure out how to view my camera feeds through a web browser.  I consider myself to be a pretty technical-minded person, and while the hardware setup was simple, the information missing from the manuals, as well as error messages written in "Engrish", made for a more frustrating experience.For the price, I probably shouldn't complain. The cameras seem to be very good quality-wise, and if I can ever get the software set up properly, it should be a solid platform. If you're a techy kinda person, I might say give these a try. If you're not, the company does offer a third-party installation service (can't vouch for them, but they do offer it).

Reviews.Title: Warning DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: I purchased this garbage in Aug 2012, installed it in Sept 2012, and the DVR stopped recording in Nov 2012.  I sent it in at my cost, and when it came back it would not even power up.  They know there's an inherent problem with the DVR, but fall short of upgrading and let you speak to a Supervisor.  This product is JUNK and I suggest you do not buy!  My advice is to pay a little more and get a real brand name.  I regret paying all the money on this system, installation, and it NOT working to secure the house!!!

Reviews.Title: Night Owl DVR
Reviews.Author: Tylerbend
Reviews.Content: The DVR is nice for the price, but the cameras are washed out with little color and blurred images. Stay away from this combo. Instead buy the Swann PRO System. It will cost a little more, but the color is much better.

Reviews.Title: Its a great security system
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: It was easy to set up just connect the cable and there you go, you have a fully functional security system. You can see the images clearly and the night vision works great too. Reason why I gave it a 4 star was because to set it up on my Iphone and Pc was really confusing and i couldn't get in contact with customer service but after many try and fail i finally got it and I'm please with the results.

Reviews.Title: Manage your expectations and you'll be happy.
Reviews.Author: A. C. Heismann "kristof65"
Reviews.Content: I installed my DVR, and 2 out of the 4 cameras over the Labor day weekend.  The biggest pain about the install for me was crawling in my attic to run the cables - I actually had to recruit my 10 year old to crawl into some cramped places for me.  I've had those two cameras running for about 4 days now, and am getting familiar with the system. I plan to mount the other two cameras this next weekend.In a nutshell, for the price, this appears to be a pretty decent system based on my experience.  I'm happy with it so far. But then, that's because I had a pretty good idea of what to expect - and what not to expect - for the money I was spending on it.A little background - from 2002 to 2005, I worked for a company that sold professional surveillance camera systems that cost from $3k on up to tens of thousands. While I didn't work with/on the camera's directly, I got to spend quite a bit of time playing with them.  So I didn't expect much from a sub $300 system, even though it's 8 years later. However, this little system easily matches and exceeds the "low end" systems my company was selling back then. So I'm getting more than I expected - which, so far, makes me happy with it.General comments- These cameras do suffer from the Woods Effect, in terms of color of vegetation. But that's ok with me, I'm more interested in what they see moving around, than in the color they render them in. Any system in this price range is likely going to have the same drawback. The $3k systems 8 years ago had this issue, too. Color balance indoors while I was testing was much, much better.- I have a couple motion activated lights around my house, and I was concerned about how the lights kicking on/off would affect the transition between day/night modes on the camera.  Now, my camera's aren't pointed right at the light, so I've been happy - there is a noticeable transition, but it doesn't affect what I can see.  However, the light kicking on/off does trip the motion capture of the DVR on it's default of 4. I just tried lowering it to 3 to see how that affects things.- night vision is good, quite usable out to about 15-20ft or so. They say 30', and I think technically it does extend out that far, but between where my current cameras are mounted, what I expect out of them, and their resolution, the 30' isn't something that matters to me. If you truly need good resolution of a night vision camera out to 30', look for a more expensive system/camera that will range out to 40-60'- Camera resolution is not going to grab the license plate number off a car pulling into my driveway, but at least I can tell types of cars apart. Again, I didn't expect them to be any better than they are.- Setting up the port forwarding was pretty simple for me. But then, I do that for industrial equipment as part of my job.  Setting up port forwarding is as much art as it is science - there are simply so many manufacturers and providers of modems and routers out there that it's going to be hard for any company to give explicit 100% accurate instructions.  In this case, Night Owl provides more than enough documentation that even the most novice network person should be able to contact their Cable/DSL modem provider or router manufacturer for help. Why not recommend Night Owl for help with that?  Because it's not a function of their equipment, it's a function of the router or modem - which is not a part of this system.- I ran into two issues while setting up the mobile applications on my phone and tablet, one minor, one very frustrating but ultimately simple to solve.  For android phones/tablets at least, Night Owl provides two different apps - Lite and Pro. Each app is aimed at a different series of their DVRs. Make sure you're using the one for your DVR.  Second issue is after you get the mobile setup done in the DVR, it appears you must reboot it before they'll actually take effect.  I spent a good hour trying all sorts of various things when finally my common troubleshooting sense kicked in and I thought "Before I contact their service, I haven't rebooted it, I wonder if that will do it?".  Lo and behold, it did.- a couple of days after I had it running on my laptop and my phone/tablet, I went to install the Netviewer program on the CD ROM on my desktop in my home office.  Unfortunately, the CD-ROM drive on my desktop decided to take a crap on me, and I couldn't load it from the CD-ROM.  "No worries," I thought, "I'll just go grab the program from their website."  That proved to be a mistake - one, I couldn't download just the one program I wanted, I had to download an entire zip file of stuff. Two, it wasn't exactly clear that zip file actually had the program I wanted in it.  And finally, three, it turns out that the version of Netviewer on their website was not the same as the one on the CD-ROM, which took me a couple of hours to sort out.  I was finally able to install it by transferring the install program from another laptop I installed it on to a USB drive, and installed it on my desktop from there.- I made sure to install the DVR in a place where it shouldn't over heat and will get some decent airflow. From my years of experience as a technician, and specifically from my years working for the company who sold camera systems, DVRs are prone to heat related failures. The less expensive a system is, the less it will have in terms of cooling. Make sure you factor that into your installation.- I made sure to measure out where my cameras were going to go, and ordered a 75' and a 100' cable extra. Turns out I probably could have done without the 100 - your situation will vary - but if you think you may need them, I highly recommend picking the cables up and having them on hand before you start your install - especially if you have to crawl through a hot, dark attic full of insulation like I did.- I was hoping to be able to handle all of the settings of the DVR from the Netviewer interface, because my monitor is my TV, and it sits a good 20' and two rooms away from where the DVR is located. That's not the case - some settings require the mouse driven menu on the DVR itself. I've ordered a 32' Active USB cable to see if I can use the mouse that way. If not, I'll have to drag up one of my PC monitors from the basement to plug in to the DVR temporarily.UPDATE: the 32' active USB extension cable works just fine. However, it turns out that there is very little in the direct interface that can't be done with the netviewer program.- someone else mentioned, and I'll second it - try and mount the cameras out of reach if you can. The video/power cables are exposed, which leaves them vulnerable to someone with a pair of wire snips.  I have a one story ranch, so I have several cameras where this is going to be an issue. However, by the time I'm done getting these four cameras up, and the next four cameras after that, I should have mine covered in such a way that at least one camera will catch something if someone tries to start snipping things.- I have not set up the email feature, and I probably won't. I know from past experience that the lower end systems tend to flood your inbox with useless emails because they're too sensitive, or not send any at all because they're not sensitive enough. I _might_ set it up should I go on vacation and turn it off when I get back.- at this point, I haven't had to contact Night Owl for any help, so I can't comment on their service. I did email them to tell them about my issue with the website and the Netviewer program. I haven't heard back from them on that, but then my email was worded in such a way that it was obvious I was contacting them for their benefit, not mine, and as such, didn't really expect a reply.Obviously, I can't report on it's long term durability right now, as I've only had it in for four days, but at this point, I'm happy, and I foresee no major issues.If you're thinking about a camera system, this one seems pretty good - but make sure it matches your expectations. If you need or want true color outdoor, high resolution, high security, extended night vision range, etc, be prepared to spend a lot more than this. If you're just looking for something to deter the neighborhood kids from cutting through your yard, and monitoring the UPS/FedEx drivers dropping off your packages, it will work just fine for you.

Reviews.Title: great little system
Reviews.Author: SingleAct
Reviews.Content: This system does just as advertised! After reading some of the mixed reviews I was hesitant to buy it, but did. Initial setup was a breeze. Plug things in, turn things on, everything works. DVR setup was equally simple. I had to call tech support when I couldn't get my Verizon wireless gateway to accept the port forwarding. I waited about 10 minutes on hold, was 3rd in line. The lady tech had my modem tweaked in no time and went on to set up the remote features. I fought with IE for a while, then just installed Night Owl's software. I was instantly controlling and seeing everything from a remote location using my laptop. On a whim I got the Nite Owl Lite app for iPod touch and within a couple of minutes I could see and control the cams from my pod. Pic quality in daylight is great, total darkness shows up bright. Five stars for this one and their tech support.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Amaury Rivera
Reviews.Content: Hook up is really simple, just plug and play, The picture quality is not what I expected, color is terrible, but you can still make out the image, night vision is really not working for me. I guess it will have to do for now. Spend the extra money and get a quality unit. This is an average unit at best. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Web interface requires active x controls and incorrect sales infomation
Reviews.Author: David M. Burke
Reviews.Content: I wanted a new DVR because my old one required old versions of Internet Explorer and a active X plugin. I was curious about this model since it claims to support IE and Safari. No mention of Firefox or Chrome? I called their sales and was assured it would run in any browser including Chrome with no plugins needed. I should have second guessed ANY browser. By any browser they mean any Internet Explorer browser and Safari if you download a OSX dmg file. Chrome on Linux prompts to download said dmg file. I called their tech support just to be sure, they claimed Internet Explorer was required to do anything.Also they have a service where to set up web access you must registrar some sub domain on their website. Why is this needed? What if they shutdown? I don't want any of my private security footage in any way connected to their website!* Update, please note it IS possible to use the desktop application to view on LAN. After reviewing other products I can see the reason for this site. It's to make it easier to set up if you don't know how to get a public IP address. Obviously this is a consumer focused product. Still it seems reasonable they could just allow you go to a LAN website and have it just work without hassle.The hardware seems fine, but I'm returning it due to the poor software it comes with.

Reviews.Title: Does the job!
Reviews.Author: Fair and Balanced
Reviews.Content: Easy to install and does a great job for basic home security.  Good value, good quality.  The 60 ft. camera feeds were ample, however, I needed one longer feed (100 ft) which I purchased on Amazon for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, so far..
Reviews.Author: Theresa Perez
Reviews.Content: We purchased this late October 2013 and installed the camera system/DVR right away. This part was easy and straight forward. We had to purchase a KVM switch to switch from the computer to monitor on the desk top, but this is due to having an older monitor. The hard part was getting to view the camera on the iPad and iPhone. After numerous tries on our own, we just called tech support and it was done in 5-10 minutes. The quality of camera viewing is fine for what this purchase is/price is. It is the lowest grade of camera, but it serves the purpose well in day and night. I mean, we all know grass is green, not purple right? What matters is the view of vehicles and people are clear. We have only had this for 1/2 month, so I will update if necessary.

Reviews.Title: Night Owl Security
Reviews.Author: J. Persaud "Joey P."
Reviews.Content: horrible cameras but dvr is ok. bought this for customer and he had better cameras before i had to take these down and buy others.

Reviews.Title: Unstable unit faulty cable and camera
Reviews.Author: prepr
Reviews.Content: I knew for the money this had to come with issues. During installation found that 1 camera and 1 cable doesn't work. The dvd unit it's self will lose video if desk it is on is slightly bumped you then have to work with the cable to the monitor to restore the video the same goes for the camera connections. I have emailed support asking about replacing camera and cable with no response thus no support.You get what you pay for but this is worthless.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money!
Reviews.Author: JoshW
Reviews.Content: Very easy setup. Couldn't really get any easier really. I ordered this for an older family member that just wants something around the house. When I compared prices of various systems, it appeared that getting 8 camera/8 channel gave the best bang for the buck compared to 4 cam/4channel. Everything was packaged nicely and easy to distinguish. We had plenty of wire for each camera so they could be mounted where needed.I'd recommend this!

Reviews.Title: Awful video
Reviews.Author: William F. Solomon
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheap security system this is it.  The cameras are bottom of the barrel.  They make the grass look white and all the other colors are not right.  When called they told me to upgrade to better cameras to get a good picture.  I asked if I could exchange the cameras that I got for a small credit on new upgraded ones and was told no way.  In other words you are stuck with the ones that are awful.  I feel they should tell you this before you order.

Reviews.Title: Know The Facts Before You Buy
Reviews.Author: M. McKinley
Reviews.Content: Night Owl advertises color camera BUT they do not discuss the "woods" effect (greens look like lavender). My cameras are installed outside where I have views of grass, trees, flowers, etc.Here is their customer's service response "The issue that you're experiencing with color on your cameras is referred to as the Wood's effect. This is a result of the infrared spectrum being picked up by the cameras, even when well-lit. The infrared bouncing off the chlorophyll in the natural plants, grass, and trees, will show up either white or silver/grey or pink/purple on the DVR. You may also see black-colored clothing show up discolored, possibly purple. The Wood's effect is normal for lower-end infrared cameras as despite well-lit conditions, the IR never completely turns off. You can read more about the Wood's effect here: [...]".  Here's a further CS response "The Wood effect is not discussed in any of our advertising literature. Any camera which uses the same sensor for visible light as infrared light will be affected by the Wood effect. You're welcome to switch vendors, but I will advise you that any infrared camera which uses the same sensor for day vision mode as for night vision mode will have the same issue. Did you read up on this at that website we linked you to?  As far as refunds go, as per our warranty, we do not offer refunds."Other than not getting color (or true colors), picture clarity is okay and the overall value for a simple system is better than Samsung's black and white system.  Since Night Owl will not offer a refund I will live with what I have but I would not recommend this to anyone unless they are willing to live with the "woods" effect.

Reviews.Title: Great system for the money
Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: Good cameras for what I need. I'm not going to pay $1000 per camera to read license plates from a half mile away. Night owl has the best tech support!!! I'm good with computers but I just couldn't figure out the iPhone/internet. They did it faster than I could follow and made sure my phone, and computers were all linked. They even sent an email of all my settings

Reviews.Title: Wonderful and the price was right!
Reviews.Author: scott moniz
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent way to start off my home security system. The cameras given do a good job in night and day about 20 yards or so. Install is a dream and its worth getting extended cables to reach the far corners of the house. With the money saved I plan to slowly get more advanced cameras to fill in the other channels, hopefully ones that I can look around with my cell phone when I am away. I have recommended this to my father and brother.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Andrew castro
Reviews.Content: The picture quality was a big let down. Colours were poor in broad daylight, the shade of the house showed no image, I wasn't sure if it was the DVR unit or cameras but that was cleared up after I used one of these bullet cam (450 TV line) on my neighbour's system (same poor colour).When I borrowed his 600 TV line cam the images was superb - great resolution and colours. My lawn which was showing pure grey was now showing its rich green colour.The DVR seems to function just fine, poor research on my part led to this bad buy, now I will have to get new cameras for this system.

Reviews.Title: not so 24/7 service
Reviews.Author: alexisockman
Reviews.Content: All customer service is is a recording whee no one will ever call back. I bought ﻿the 4 camera 8 channel system. It was easy to set up but have one camera with no night vision and problems with my dvr now. Trying to get in touch with nightowl two times now and no callback. 24 hour support is a joke. If you go to ﻿the sight you will see they do not even have a number to call without registering your life history. Easy to hook up just hope you don't need help because you are on your own.

Reviews.Title: GREAT system great price, Love this system.
Reviews.Author: Renee Tressler
Reviews.Content: Love this system. My house was broken into less than a year ago, the cops did absolutely nothing, so I was not going to let it happen again. I purchased this system 6 months ago and already added 3 additional cameras. The system was easy to set up and install. I downloaded the Night Owl mobile APP and can check my system from my smart phone. Also set up my network, so I can check my system from ANY computer connected to the internet. Set up was extremely easy, I watched several of the video's on the Night Owl website, I tested everything on my dining room table before I installed the cameras and everything worked fine. Tech support is fast ! I actually sent an e-mail asking how to back up an "event" to thumb drive. The responded in less than 3 minutes, and gave me exact instructions on how to do this, I had everything done in a few minutes. We had a severe storm in my area and lightning struck the telephone pole next to my house only 30 ft away, unfortunately it blew two of my cameras, I contacted Night Owl, and they had 2 replacement cameras at my house in less than a week. This is a fantastic system. I would recommend it to anyone wanting a great security system at a great price.

Reviews.Title: DId Not Last One Year
Reviews.Author: Jessica W.
Reviews.Content: This product was purchased in December 2012 and isn't working. Seems like the hard drive is broken and will not record anything.

Reviews.Title: Good. But flimsy attachment screw.
Reviews.Author: Venkat
Reviews.Content: This is a good surveillance system. Has internet capability. You need to setup a few network parameters. User setup guide is simple and to the point. Long 60' cables. However I ended up buying more cable (purely my requirement.)  User friendly setup.Cameras work good over extended cables (more than 100').Picture quality (color) with their supplied cables is distorted but it is not a serious flaw.Con: The adapter to attach cameras to base is very very flimsy. Almost all cameras screws broke after second adjustment.Do not install the base too close to any obstruction ( a beam). Leave at least 1.5" gap. Otherwise the screw (if it is positioned close to obstruction) is not adjustable. In certain angles the camera is not adjustable to bottom facing. This is a design flaw in base plate adapter. The screw assembly hinders camera adjustment.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: WildRage
Reviews.Content: I bought this from a mega department store last week and must say I am disappointed.  I really, really, really wanted this setup to work, but I got way too frustrated, packed it all up, and took it back.  My primary reason for purchasing this was to monitor my home remotely when I was away.  After working for several hours to get it setup, I came to the conclusion that either 1) my unit was defective, 2) the functionality just isn't there, or 3) the setup is so crazy complicated, that it isn't worth my time.  I am also a senior consultant in the technology industry for a huge multinational corporation, so doing things like configuring ports, IP addresses, subdomains, etc. are second nature to me.  I couldn't get my laptop to connect to the cameras when on the same router, I couldn't get my phone to connect to it after verifying all of the settings multiple times - and the App they have (Android) just constantly crashed.  After fiddling with it for over an hour, I told myself that one more crash and I was going to take it back to the store - and the rest is history. As far as the cameras and recording is concerned, I had the unit setup in no time - but if your primary purpose is to network this badboy - good luck, you've got a journey ahead!

Reviews.Title: I bit annoying
Reviews.Author: DLee107
Reviews.Content: As far as being a camera it does that great. It records and has decent quality picture. But the mounting brackets are kind of a pain and do no get me started on trying to port forward the cameras connection on your own. Good god I didn't think I'd need a PHD to install a freaking security camera system.

Reviews.Title: Simple to Install....... Tougher to tie in to the network
Reviews.Author: Krayzie77
Reviews.Content: I bought this a while back when it was on Amazon's Lightning deals.  It really was a great deal.  4 cameras, 500GB HDD, network to the internet, notification email and the best part of all was that there were no monthly fees.  No brainer right?  Especially since I just moved into my first townhouse.  The area I moved into is a quiet area but the town to the next of us isn't so friendly so I figured this would give me at least a deterrent from being a victim.  Got the cameras in classic quick amazon fashion and put the box in one of the rooms and mentally added it to my "honey do" list.Well, things got put off and a month goes by with me thinking that I'll just do it the next week.  Until I get home from work one day and find that someone broke into my house.  One of the hardest lessons I had to learn and just the feeling that someone went though my house was enough for me to take the next few days off of work and secure my house.  Ironically, they didn't take the security camera system.My girlfriend and I installed the cameras with little to no problems.  With the help of an extension ladder and drill, we hardwired it in 4 hours.  We live in a two story townhouse and my thinking was to mount the cameras high, near the roof soffits.  Then wire it through a drilled out hole to the attic.  Finally having all the camera wires drop down into the 2nd floor master bedroom.  After everything was hooked up, we fired up the tv and we had the four camera screens online.  After a few tweaks to the position of each camera, we were satisfied.Networking to the router to let outside computers/phones access the cameras was a headache.  Their instruction sheet looked very simple.  I guess the part I got caught up on was the port forwarding.  Now I know how to port forward but I forgot that I had other things port forwarded on those ports they suggested using (a nas storage device for one).  After a few days figuring that out and trying to understand their workaround to dynamic ip address I was able to view in anywhere on my iphone.  The lag/refresh rate using my phone on a 3g connection is pretty impressive.  The resolution was "okay".  To this date, i'm still haven't got the motion email messaging alert to work correctly.  I'm guessing this is due to me using a hotmail email server as opposed to an isp ran email server.  Again, I just need to find the time and keep working at itHardware quality:The main unit is very simple.  No hdmi out so I had to use rca composite.  Remote leave alot to be desired but I just use a wireless logitech mouse instead.  It makes things a lot easier.  When I purchased, I was thinking that the wires wouldn't be long enough but surprisingly they were a lot longer than needed.  Loved that the cameras were metal and had some weight to them.  Hung them under the roof ledge so I don't know how water resistant they are.  I didn't like that the cord from the camera didn't go through the mounts.  That was the reason why i choose to mount them so high (roof level on a 2 story townhouse).  Was worried someone could just cut the wire.  Again, resolution isn't the best.  which is to be expected at this price point.  The night vision is really around 30ft.  Im a little worried on how clear faces would show up in a real burglary.  However they do make better cameras that you can purchase (ie ones with 90ft night vision). Camera's use a two wire hookup to main receiver (BNC connector and small 12volt power).  Motion sensitivity and area are adjustable.  HDD size is amazing and at this low resolution I can record more than a week nonstop .Overall I'm satisfied with this product at this price point (<$200).  Again, it's mainly a deterrent. If someone is in the same boat I was and now looking for an alarm system, I recommend Simplisafe.

Reviews.Title: Excelent system for the price
Reviews.Author: James W. Quartel "Jimq"
Reviews.Content: I bought the system a couple months ago and finally got up north to my summer beach home to install a couple weeks ago. Hooking up the cameras was a breeze. Running the wires thru the eaves into attic in my 85 old house not so easy. Just as a suggestion use different screws than were supplied to mount the cameras. The heads strip very easily.  After getting the cameras all installed I ran into a snag on setting up the router. I called customer service and after a 10 minute wait got a really helpful tech on line. He took over my computer and after 15 minutes had everything up and running on the computer, Android tablet and phone. Now I can sit here at home in Florida and watch the waves and storms as they happen at the other house. The cameras are just so so. I tried adjusting the color but gave up. For what I need they work fine. I can see gulls and ducks 2-300 feet away flying by or paddling up the bay. I think I will find one new camera that has a wider field of vision and possibly panning ability for the one I mounted at the top of the gable end looking out at the water/beach and yard.  Another feature I really like is the ability to change DVR settings with my computer remotely  800 miles away using the program that came on the enclosed CD. Those pesky waves on the bay were turning on the motion detector to much so with the programs ability to block areas of motion my DVR isnt recording nearly as much. I think bugs and spiders like the night vision sensors because it seems they are always flying by or building webs in front of them.I am totally happy with the purchase. Only reason I didnt give it 5 stars was because of the cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great product when all setup right!
Reviews.Author: Duc X Tran
Reviews.Content: This product works very well if you get it setup right.  The web or smartphone viewing is extremely difficult setup you have to call tech support to help you open media channels for your router.  Manufacture needs more detail and easier on how to setup online viewing so end users need not to call tech support.

Reviews.Title: Arrived on time
Reviews.Author: socraticmethod
Reviews.Content: It seems to be working as described.I did see one review where the OP said that the power cord for the cameras did not deliver enough to keep all working simultaneously.With that in mind I checked that first. Lo and behold ALL FOUR CAMERAS displayed nicely on the TV. Weather has been of the kind prohibiting full install. If I have issues I will amend my review accordingly.The only downside I see is that the instructions are a little lacking, though the onscreen menus seemed intuitive enough that I was able to put the cameras through a cycle and also to display all cameras simultaneously.UPDATE:The system is up and running for 3 days now no glitches w/DVR as I have seen in at least one other review.Night vision is great for the price. Much to the neighbor's chagrin (for whom it was purchased,[I'll leave it at that]).

Reviews.Title: just hope you don't get a defective product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This product was defective with a hard drive problem.  I called for support and they were nice and  after several e mails and days later,  they require the customer to pay to ship the unit back, you also must have all reciepts or it will be returned c.o.d. ( I have purchased many items from Amazon without a problem.)  The night owl company also told me to expect to wait 6 to 8 weeks for them to ship another unit.  I wish I had made this purchase in a block and morter store.  I will write another review maybe they will try harder to resolve the issue. This was a new product purchased for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Kelly W "KLW"
Reviews.Content: We bought this after some opportunist crimes in our normally safe neighborhood (packages stole from porches etc).  A friend had it at their house and sent us some still shots and we were sold.  It looks great during the day and at night - we have one that gets some light at night from a street lamp and one side that is completely dark and you can still make out the age/race/clothing etc of a person.The only painful part was running the cables in our odd roof line - but you will get that with any system.  Our electrician's apprentice was able to run the cables through the attic for us which just left connecting the attachments to us.  One thing that stumped us was whether to put the connectors in the roof/walls or outside?  We left them outside so if we had a change out a camera we could do it ourselves and just bought some electrical boxes to screw over them and paint to match the soffit.  We had to buy 2 extra long cables for 80ft runs and had no drop in quality over that distance.We also liked it was recording only when it sensed motion so we didn't use up space quickly.  We haven't had to review it for any people sneaking around but we did discover a lot of furry night time visitors coming over the fence under one!Overall a really good system that is pretty much plug and play and doesn't require a lot of technical knowledge at all.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Chelsea Collett
Reviews.Content: This camera system was easy to install and operate! Hooked right up to our TV and the cords were long enough for our needs.The picture is great day and night!

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: Linda M. Fields
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas Gift for my oldest son and his family. He has it "up and running" and says it more than meets his needs. He feels his property is much better protected now.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Brenda   Badger
Reviews.Content: A very easy set up of dvr and cameras had working within half an hour, did have a problem with forwarding port, but a tech named Jess helped me through the whole procedure and got it up and running on my laptop within 15 minutes, awesome tech support, the cameras do not have a very wide range but I purchased a 360 pan & tilt camera that is compatible and this works very good with Night Owl dvr.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Not to bad of a system.  Use it everyday to keep an eye on my house.  Worked great with your smartphone.  I'm an IT guy so port forwarding in my router wasnt an issue, and night owl offers free dyn dns so you dont need a static IP.  I like the system.  cheap, easy to install, and easy to maintain.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Krista
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for our house security.  I have a housecleaner come in weekly, and it's important to us that we know what's going on in our, and outside of our home.  These work very well.  THe night vision is incredible.  This kit was about 100$ less than the Samsung version, but this had better ratings.  Works great, would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Very good system and service, router programming instructions need work
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: Very easy system to install. The instructions for connecting through a router was not clear.  Particularly the preset server port number must only be used.  Other than that the free ip redirecting service works very well. The iphone ap works very well.

Reviews.Title: Great low cost CCTV System
Reviews.Author: Pedro M. Ariza
Reviews.Content: This is a great package deal for the cost. The free DDNS account makes viewing the system remotely via the Internet on a computer (PC or Mac) or mobile device (Apple, Windows and others) is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Denise Reed
Reviews.Content: Seems to be good.. Night time pic isn't perfect but good. For the price u r getting a good deal.

Reviews.Title: ok system
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: The cameras and DVR work great!!!! But having a lot of problems with viewing my cameras on the app away from my WiFi.

Reviews.Title: Good System For The Money
Reviews.Author: Charles M.
Reviews.Content: Good System.  The grass is purple & the hedges are pink looking though.. that really doesnt bother me much.  you can upgrade to better cameras one at a time later & they will plug right in to the wires that are currently there when you want.  spiderwebs will sometimes cover a camera at night.  i have my cams all hooked up to my cell phone too which is a big plus.  its cool to see who just rang your doorbell by picking up your cell phone lol

Reviews.Title: It works good.  I like it.
Reviews.Author: Karalynne McCarthy
Reviews.Content: Easy to install cameras and DVR.  Running wires yourself is challenging if you go through the attic.  Camera picture quality is ok.  Can be blurry looking outside with wind and rain and general movement.  Not crystal clear.Setting up to view on internet/iphone/ipad required 2 calls to customer service.  They were super nice and helpful and resloved the issues.  I really did try to follow their enclosed instructions, but still needed help.  I do wish there was a printed manual rather than the CD.

Reviews.Title: overall pleased
Reviews.Author: itsmeagain
Reviews.Content: A little harder than i expected to set up the remote viewing. I had to buy a new router to make it work. I also seem to have a hard time finding a happy medium for the motion recording sensitivity. One of the cameras didn't work out of the box but amazon sent out the replacement right away.

Reviews.Title: So far a great product!
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Poling "marisean"
Reviews.Content: The item arrived quickly and was easy to set up the DVR. I had a problem with the internet viewing but call their great tech support and they us up and running in minutes.

Reviews.Title: night owl
Reviews.Author: Dawn Ramsdell
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice security camera set, easy to set up and price was right. I enjoy it very much

Reviews.Title: great for the money, camera field of view is very narrow
Reviews.Author: diman
Reviews.Content: great system, easy to setup, I will agree with a previous reviewer - you have to setup a username and password if you want to access the system remotely, it will not work otherwisecamera field of view is very very narrow, meaning that you will have to mount cameras far back in order to capture a good wide video view.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera System For The Price!
Reviews.Author: Nardo
Reviews.Content: This system was delivered within 2 days of ordering, was very easy to install and works great.  I am surprised by the quality of the night vision.  The screen actually looks very dark at night, but when someone walks within camera range, it lights them up and produces an excellent quality picture.  A word of caution, the customer support line is loaded, so be prepared to wait.

Reviews.Title: good cameras
Reviews.Author: jay77
Reviews.Content: these are not the best camera you can get but they do the job for the priceprosthey were easy to hook up and to get online just follow the instructionsconsthe cameras are not the clearest

Reviews.Title: A Great Value
Reviews.Author: Bozo
Reviews.Content: The cameras and DVR were very easy to set up.  The quaity of the image certainly isn't like watching TV, but it's clear enough to make an identification if necessary.  The night vision works great.  Don't know that it actually reaches 30', but it certainly met my needs.  I find it hard to believe that the length of the camera wires is truly 60' and I had to order some extensions.I have one of the cameras outside.  It's under an eve so a little sheltered, but still subject to the cold nights of February in northern NJ and it continues to perform flawlessly.Networking was a complicated process and I needed to use their support a couple of times.  Good news is that their support is 24/7 and they were very good.This system is brand new and we'll have to see how it holds up over time, but for now, I'm very impressed with the quality of product and service for the price.

Reviews.Title: great security system
Reviews.Author: Tish
Reviews.Content: They work great even at night great security protection.  we even use 2 of the cameras in the calf area to watch the mama cow cows when they calf.  Easy to install and operate.  Very good security system

Reviews.Title: Not recommended - poor warranty support
Reviews.Author: Arcanumy
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 16 camera unit from NightOwl two years ago. Within 10 months the fans on the DVR started to fail and make a very high pitched whining sound. NightOwl fixed them under warranty and exactly 10 months later they failed again and they will not honor the warranty a second time even though the same exact part failed.NightOwl products do not hold up to constant use despite the fact that a video surveillance system is on 24x7. Their iPhone support is also very poor as none of the apps they recommend will work properly with a 16 camera unit.

Reviews.Title: night owl
Reviews.Author: Duang C. Lee "leelor"
Reviews.Content: this camera bad picture ,color is awful now the system shutdown and start up every 3-5 minutes by it self . do not buy this item ,i can't use it,i waste my time for install all over my house now need to remove and trash it or someone want it pay the shipping handling i ship to you

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: dbx820
Reviews.Content: I have had this running for a few months now and I am very happy. All it took was a skinny nephew to get in the attic and drill a couple of holes to run the wires. Connection is plug and play and all menus are mouse-driven. It operates independently from your PC.  It is NOT the best picture quality out there but for the price it will do. You can configure it so that you can access the cameras from your smart phone but I am not smart enough to figure it out (guess I need the computer nerd nephew for that). What is most important is not what I see but what any potential thief will see--cameras staring unblinkingly at them. They will go elsewhere. And that is what it is all about.

Reviews.Title: Absolute Garbage
Reviews.Author: Knight
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money, horrible customer support, never got it to work on the internet, terrible color, after 6 months all I get is shaky lines of strange color and a very poor picture behind the moving lines of color. Absolutely  worthless.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Thomas
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Night Owl security system with 4 channels and a 500 gig DVR and installed myself during the cooler months.  Installation is fairly simple, however the product itself is cheap and not worth your time or money.  The cameras are not conducive to outdoor humidity and weather.  Two out of my four cameras failed due to possible rainwithin 8 months.  A replacement Night Owl camera was purchased via Amazon and upon installation, the machined screws sheared apart.  Not to mention, the suggested Application upon my smart phone will not port through my Internet service, to view via phone.  Pay the extra money and have a professional company or local cable/Internet service install a system that is warrantied and that has service options.

Reviews.Title: Works well but video quality is not great
Reviews.Author: Mitch Crain
Reviews.Content: This system works well for the money, but if you expect to be able to read license plates from greater than 15 feet with these cameras, you will be disappointed.  This is not a high end security system, but accomplishes the goal if you don't want to pay monthly fees to a security company to store the video on their servers.The DVR works well, and is pretty intuitive, and it's easy to search for videos and save them to a flash drive.  The motion detection setting actually starts the recording about 10 seconds before the motion is detected, so you can see what happened a few moments before the person or car approaches.Some other commenters have mentioned this problem: During the daytime, the color is awful.  Green things (trees, grass) turn blue or purple.  At night, when it turns to black and white, obviously this problem doesn't exist.The screws for installing the cameras are flimsy.  Go the hardware store and get some sturdier #6 wood screws (3/4 inch or 1 inch length works well) if you're mounting the cameras in wood.  Each camera requires 3 screws.All in all, it accomplishes the goal I wanted, which is to serve as a deterrent, and allows me to see people and cars as they walk or drive by.  However, if you really need a higher definition camera system, then you should either purchase a different system or purchase better cameras, which you will obviously pay a lot more for; or pay a monthly fee to a higher end service from ADT or other security company.

Reviews.Title: Night Owl Security STA-84
Reviews.Author: YhwhKhai
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say purchasing this Night Owl security system has been a great experience thus far.I opened the box and tested all of the cameras and they all worked just fine. I tried for 2 days unsuccessfully to be able to view my cameras over the Internet. I wanted to try it myself because customer service on many products have been a total nightmare. After feeling frustrated and not understanding why I kept having port issues, I called Night Owl customer service and explained the problem to them. I only waited about 10 minutes for an agent to come to the phone. Once I explained the problem, they sent me a file for me to download in order for them to be able to view the problem on my laptop. I was watching everything happen in real time. They diagnosed the situation and immediately corrected the port issues I was having. Right after that I was able to view my cameras on my laptop and android phone.I contacted customer service a week later because I couldn't view my cameras over my phone. I waited on hold for about 20 minutes for an agent to help me. I felt like a real jerk after I discovered I forgot sto plug the ethernet cable back into my router while I was in the process of removing furniture.... duh! These guys are so helpful it's ridiculous.I had my handyman install one of the cameras above my front door. I'm quite amazed by the quality of cameras. The night vision isn't bad at all. I'm rather impressed. I got these cameras mainly because I was quite curious as to what really goes on around my property while I'm at work. So far I'm loving them. I plan to order 4 more cameras.(I will update this review if anything changes.)

Reviews.Title: Compact with improved user interface
Reviews.Author: Benjamin F Chen
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd 16 Channel DVR that I have purchased from Night Owl.  The old model I had just decided to stop working one day.  This unit is compact and lightweight and contains all of the normal features.  The IP setup is fairly easy and you can use the included CD to install the mobile app or download one from an appstore.  The box includes the unit, 8 cameras w/cables, remote with batteries, install CD, power cord and usb mouse.The remote is basic and functional.The software has a more polished look from older models.  It has been in use for a couple of months and it's been performing well.

Reviews.Title: Good basic system
Reviews.Author: Joe Crump
Reviews.Content: Good basic system, set up is easy, good quality picture, controls are easy to navigate, kit comes complete with what us needed to get started.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to set up, very narrow range of vision, poor image quality
Reviews.Author: J. Anderson
Reviews.Content: The cameras in this system do not compare to the quality of my laptop webcam. They also have a very narrow range of vision, it is like a zoomed-in camera. Mounted in the top corner of a room that is about 20x20 ft, you can see about 5 ft in either direction of the opposite corner, this means you would need about 10 of these cameras to see all of a 20x20 room.Set up was difficult. Required a call to tech support that lasted about 45 minutes, and still can not set up for half of the features described in the listing. I cannot record. I cannot set up motion activation - the system is useless. Spend a little more and get something that will actually work.

Reviews.Title: Works well but no help available
Reviews.Author: Lucky13 "Lucky 13"
Reviews.Content: Works well but I can't get the picture to work on my iphone. It would be nice if it would work, I would sure have rated it better

Reviews.Title: security cam
Reviews.Author: Darren Avado Pennerman
Reviews.Content: Excellent, works well and it is very clear forViewing. I would rrecommend this to anyone looking for a good security monitoring system.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up -but I have pink grass
Reviews.Author: Frank "Frank in Bensalem"
Reviews.Content: The color adjustment leaves a lot to be desired, but it is easy [for me] to set it up.  There are a lot of hidden features - you have to try different menus.  Instructions are weak.

Reviews.Title: No Support
Reviews.Author: Matthew Keith
Reviews.Content: Hooked up the system with no trouble until I started setting the router for port forwarding. One of the ports in the manual wasn't being accepted by the router. Called tech support. Waited on hold for 44 minutes. Hung up--never got a human being. Decided to try a random port number close to the one that was supposed to be used... seemed to work. Then the display on the monitor turned off. Just completely stopped working. Called tech support. Waited on hold for 49 minutes. Hung up--never got a human being. Took down all the cameras, boxed it all back up and returned the system.Best part about the system was that it was sold by Amazon and they allowed me to return it with no questions asked, so... thank you Amazon, you rock! Night Owl--you suck.

Reviews.Title: Works like a champ but average quality video.
Reviews.Author: Johnny Wilson
Reviews.Content: We can see what everyone is doing outside our door and home, but it would be difficult to know who someone is when very far away at all.  For shorter distances and descent quality video, this thing works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Good but could be better
Reviews.Author: Gregory
Reviews.Content: This system is definitely not a plug and play system, it does take a level of expertise and patience. Tech Support is generally friendly and typically resolve your issues. Reviews.Title: Ok, but the lack of day time light will give incorrect daytime colors.
Reviews.Author: JR Lewis
Reviews.Content: I bought these for daytime security, not specifically night time.  The infrared sensitive camera & lights don't work well during the day.Mounting cameras under the eaves of your house or in shade or on real cloudy days will trigger the infrared during the daytime hours...  Giving your daytime video inaccurate colors (e.g. plants are pink/aqua, dark clothes look grey, etc.)If you want accurate day time color for security and identifying trespassers, you've got to mount these cameras in open sun light.The direct sun on the camera and IR sensor will turn off the infrared.I tried disconnecting the infrared led lights (easy to do by removing the front cap and taking off 2 small screws).It helped a little.Separate from the infrared led lights, the camera also has a light sensor.So, with the infrared lights off,  in low light (like shade or real cloudy days) the video is b/w.On bright sunny days or if I mount the camera in the open,  the color is true.However,  disconnecting the IR lights, gives me limited night vision range and I can only see what is lit from existing lights (porch & driveway).  Which is actually pretty good for monitoring close to the house.Night Owl support says that the higher end cameras with 600TVL will not have this daytime infrared problem.  But disconnecting the IR works for my needs.

Don't get me wrong, you aren't going to be able to James Bond spy on people, but you will be able to record for insurance purposes and POSSIBLY be able to identify people if they broke in. Reviews.Author: nitesky
Reviews.Content: -1 star for not a lick of customer service. Night owl claims they have 24/7 phone tech support.  It does not exist.  I've called their 800 # 6 times now trying to get them on the horn just for a few simple questions. (sat on hold one morning for an hr, nothing) I've tried calling early in the morning thinking they would not be busy, nothing. 1 866 390 1303, call it, no one will pick up, ever.  Who ever is saying that their customer support is good here on amazon are liars and most likely someone at the company leaving feedback here.The lack of color rendition on the bullet cams.  It cannot be adjusted to correct it, so I turned the saturation down to zero.  Now it records in black and white, which is fine for my needs.  I've read alot of night vision security cams suffer from this.I have not connected my system to the internet, nor do I plan on it, so I can't offer any feedback here.Everything worked out of the box and was super easy to hook up.  The hardest part is running cam wires.The night vision does work very well.  I have 3 of my cams up so far and they do their job in pitch darkness.  Also the infrared lights on the cam just barely glow and cannot be seen from the street, which is 30 feet away.  I like that.  They disappear into the night.For the money this is a nice entry level system, I would buy it again.

Right out of the box the dvr has worked great.  Image quality is not the greatest, but again, for the price it is sufficient.The only issue I had setting it up for remote viewing had less to do with how the dvr works and more to do with terminology used in the instructions for the dvr and router.  The dvr uses one term and the manufacture for our internet router uses another.  Once I figured that out it connected right away and I was able to view the cameras from my smartphone and home computer with no problems.If you are like me and have a very limited budget for your security system I would recommend the Night Owl system with no reservations.
